commit_message:
get-ansible-role-requirements: Use refspec when outside of OpenStack CI

This is a fixup for a6e2e511a47e("Use refspec to try Gerrit changes").
We also need to take the refspec parameter into consideration when
cloning repositories outside of OpenStack CI. This will facilitate
manual testing.

Change-Id: Ie96eb6dcd14cfec8c2b3813fbd67eef441178cdb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests refs/changes/08/575708/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: refspec: "{{ item['refspec'] | default(omit) }}"

commit_message:
Follow the new PTI for document build

For compliance with the Project Testing Interface as described in:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128594.html

Some docstrings had to be updated to avoid ambiguous references to exceptions
that are available both through ironic_inspector_client and
ironic_inspector_client.v1.

Co-Authored-By: Nguyen Hai <nguyentrihai93@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Tantsur <dtantsur@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ib24cd87aedce77f3f0fa49245408ee83e7a9eef0

commit_message:
Ceph: update daemonset overrides to reference correct key

This PS updates the ceph daemonset over-rides function to
reference the correct key, rather than the chart name to
apply host/label specific configuration.

Change-Id: Id4004077a7cc0e7e4caceff6779165e8a7c3e6ef
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
Switch bifrost jobs to nonvoting

bifrost doesn't have a symmetrical gate with ironic, which means
sometimes it can get broken by ironic changes. It's important that we
don't break bifrost, but sometimes it can break us, so let's change it
to non-voting and pay attention to it.

Change-Id: I69a6c4b05cfeebb31721c9787241161a080da045

commit_message:
Fix the None value of Q_PLUGIN_CONF_FILE if enable neutron-*

Currently, the devstack installs neutron with 2 ways, one uses
neutron-legacy, the other uses new-neutron-configure way. So they use
different variables. This patch fixes the 'Q_PLUGIN_CONF_FILE' which
from neutron-legacy part.

Change-Id: I303711ba166ece4e6f51b712284c69a0fb342e25
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas refs/changes/87/575687/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # If user enable the Neutron service_name like "q-*", # the "Q_PLUGIN_CONF_FILE" would be the ml2 config path # But if user enable the Neutron service name like "neutron-*", # the same value will be stored into "NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN_CONF" COMPATIBLE_NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN_CONF=`[ -n "$Q_PLUGIN_CONF_FILE" ] && echo $Q_PLUGIN_CONF_FILE || echo $NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN_CONF` $NEUTRON_BIN_DIR/neutron-db-manage --subproject neutron-lbaas --config-file $NEUTRON_CONF --config-file /$COMPATIBLE_NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN_CONF upgrade head
deleted_lines: $NEUTRON_BIN_DIR/neutron-db-manage --subproject neutron-lbaas --config-file $NEUTRON_CONF --config-file /$Q_PLUGIN_CONF_FILE upgrade head

commit_message:
Switch to oslo_messaging.ConfFixture.transport_url

oslo_messaging's rpc_backend setting, which is set by
ConfFixture.transport_driver has been deprecated since Newton. To allow
oslo_messaging to remove it, switch to setting transport_url instead.

Change-Id: Ideded5eff79425a813062cfb341ae8c005030544
Partial-Bug: #1712399

deleted_lines: self.messaging_conf.transport_driver = 'fake'

subject: Metadata-API fails to retrieve avz for instances created before Pike
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-30 21:56:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/eeabe55fbaadc04ff28a8e92292e7a661ce26690', 'message': 'Metadata-API fails to retrieve avz for instances created before Pike

In Pike (through change: I8d426f2635232ffc4b510548a905794ca88d7f99)
we started setting instance.avilability_zone during schedule time by
calculating the avz of the host into which the instance was scheduled
into. After this change was introduced, the metadata request for the avz
on the instance (through change: I73c3b10e52ab4cfda9dacc0c0ba92d1fcb60bcc9)
started using instance.get(availability_zone) instead of doing the upcall.
However this would return None for instances older than Pike whose
availability_zone was not mentioned during boot time as it would be set to
CONF.default_schedule_zone whose default value is None.

This patch adds an online_migration tool to populate missing
instance.availability_zone values.

Conflicts:
      nova/cmd/manage.py
      nova/tests/functional/db/test_instance.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflicts are due to the following changes which
were added in Queens:

  I6db4eb46df0d7ec025b969a46621823957503958

  I5b4b235b88367c361d38371d430d67ff583a906c

  I4b33751b6793f60c6f2703c379c36387c49d866d

commit_message:
Metadata-API fails to retrieve avz for instances created before Pike

In Pike (through change: I8d426f2635232ffc4b510548a905794ca88d7f99)
we started setting instance.avilability_zone during schedule time by
calculating the avz of the host into which the instance was scheduled
into. After this change was introduced, the metadata request for the avz
on the instance (through change: I73c3b10e52ab4cfda9dacc0c0ba92d1fcb60bcc9)
started using instance.get(availability_zone) instead of doing the upcall.
However this would return None for instances older than Pike whose
availability_zone was not mentioned during boot time as it would be set to
CONF.default_schedule_zone whose default value is None.

This patch adds an online_migration tool to populate missing
instance.availability_zone values.

Conflicts:
      nova/cmd/manage.py
      nova/tests/functional/db/test_instance.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflicts are due to the following changes which
were added in Queens:

  I6db4eb46df0d7ec025b969a46621823957503958

  I5b4b235b88367c361d38371d430d67ff583a906c

  I4b33751b6793f60c6f2703c379c36387c49d866d

Change-Id: I2a1d81bfeb1ea006c16d8f403e045e9acedcbe57
Closes-Bug: #1768876
(cherry picked from commit 6b4c38c04177ff194d05368cd4aff69958075167)
(cherry picked from commit 0a481a52929626c5fab8fd6fd50cca6882db3bd9)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/20/571320/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova import availability_zones as avail_zone@db_api.pick_context_manager_writer def populate_missing_availability_zones(context, count): instances = (context.session.query(models.Instance). filter_by(availability_zone=None).limit(count).all()) count_all = len(instances) count_hit = 0 for instance in instances: az = avail_zone.get_instance_availability_zone(context, instance) instance.availability_zone = az instance.save(context.session) count_hit += 1 return count_all, count_hit

subject: Fix: sphinx-docs job for stable branch and pep8 issues
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-20 07:47:21.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_vpnaas/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/3ea02b2a773e_add_index_tenant_id.py', 'tools/tox_install.sh', 'neutron_vpnaas/tests/unit/services/vpn/device_drivers/test_ipsec.py', 'neutron_vpnaas/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/mitaka/expand/41b509d10b5e_vpnaas_endpoint_groups.py', 'neutron_vpnaas/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/liberty/contract/333dfd6afaa2_populate_vpn_service_table_fields.py', 'neutron_vpnaas/db/vpn/vpn_db.py', 'releasenotes/source/conf.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/commit/080974ef5a4404b5d7bad8d9dc6f799c9e04cca6', 'message': 'Fix: sphinx-docs job for stable branch and pep8 issues

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on stable branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to pip.

Pep8 job is broken due to recent pep8 upgrade and corresponding
pycodestyle update.

This commit fixes the following errors:
  - E731 do not assign a lambda expression, use a def
  - W503 line break before binary operator
  - E402 module level import not at top of file

commit_message:
Fix: sphinx-docs job for stable branch and pep8 issues

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on stable branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to pip.

Pep8 job is broken due to recent pep8 upgrade and corresponding
pycodestyle update.

This commit fixes the following errors:
  - E731 do not assign a lambda expression, use a def
  - W503 line break before binary operator
  - E402 module level import not at top of file

Change-Id: I55879d70f05de60a423176e5bf1803758f27c691
(cherry picked from commit 753bb7bbaf8176c3349259e8f0d6f7bb19d77bcd)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-07 21:28:01.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_log/tests/unit/test_log.py', 'oslo_log/handlers.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.log/commit/9d5065ea327f39198d0bfffcf865fbcc1afc7d5a', 'message': "Automatically append reset_color to log lines

It's confusing that log colors can persist across multiple log lines
if they are not explicitly reset at the end of each line.  This

commit_message:
Automatically append reset_color to log lines

It's confusing that log colors can persist across multiple log lines
if they are not explicitly reset at the end of each line.  This
change automatically appends the reset escape sequence to the end of
each log record passed through the ColorHandler so the behavior is
more what most people would expect.

Change-Id: I5fefdbdd7dd2ca437863bf2117b5a93b527e9776
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.log refs/changes/47/573447/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: To use, include a '%(color)s' entry in the logging_context_format_string. There is also a '%(reset_color)s' key that can be used to manually reset the color within a log line. return logging.StreamHandler.format(self, record) + record.reset_color
deleted_lines: To use, include a '%(color)s' entry in the logging_context_format_string and a '%(reset_color)s' entry at the end of the format string so that the color setting does not persist between log lines. return logging.StreamHandler.format(self, record)

commit_message:
Handle strings as booleans in nova.network.model.VIF utils

The is_hybrid_plug_enabled and is_neutron_filtering_enabled
methods are used in _nova_to_osvif_vif_ovs to determine
if we should have a VIFBridge object or a VIFOpenVSwitch
object. The values in the vif details dict-o-doom are neutron
backend driver dependent, and not validated via schema, so
we could get strings instead of booleans and since:

  if "False":
      ...

equates to True, we can end up getting the wrong type of
os-vif object which can cause vif plugging to fail.

This uses the strutils.bool_from_string utility to convert
strings (if there are strings) to booleans.

Change-Id: I53223da95da61440d0f9b1cd02bf9e8e5ccde818
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/64/576664/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_utils import strutils # Handle an ML2 mechanism driver passing the value as a string rather # than a boolean. return strutils.bool_from_string( self['details'].get(VIF_DETAILS_OVS_HYBRID_PLUG), default=False) # Handle an ML2 mechanism driver passing the value as a string rather # than a boolean. return strutils.bool_from_string( self['details'].get(VIF_DETAILS_PORT_FILTER), default=False)
deleted_lines: return self['details'].get(VIF_DETAILS_OVS_HYBRID_PLUG, False) return self['details'].get(VIF_DETAILS_PORT_FILTER, False)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-12 00:23:16.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/release-tools/commit/a0b24989373e98579f4adca51e4ac4a8747e4ad6', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that

'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Icbd5b9ce255ae57b75fd58335b6c4d1df36f49ae
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/release-tools refs/changes/95/574495/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: envlist = py27,py35,pep8,bashatebasepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3
deleted_lines: envlist = py27,pep8,bashate

commit_message:
Add required packages to build mysql-python

The horizon deploys are failing due to missing packages required to
install the mysql-python pip package. This PR adds those in.

Depends-On: I3df2c670beeb78baaa1515bcd27e8f2b0d95b3a9
Change-Id: I20abe34118014f9bca03daadf5d1f14b7f9fd0ff

added_lines: - libmariadbclient-dev # required to build MySQL-python

@Redfish.Settings is a special field (annotation) that does not appear

of the resource where immediate application of updates is not possible
and need to restart system or a service for the values to take effect.

are: BIOS, Ethernet Interface and Storage.

Severity, MessageArgs and Resolution fields as could not find existing
samples holding these fields.

@Redfish.Settings is a special field (annotation) that does not appear
as a property in any schemas of Redfish resources.
Theoretically it can be present in any resource.
Practically this field is added to resources that support future state
of the resource where immediate application of updates is not possible
and need to restart system or a service for the values to take effect.
So far it has been identified that resources that can have this field
are: BIOS, Ethernet Interface and Storage.
If @Redfish.Settings is present on the resource, then need to use URI
in its subfield SettingsObject to update resource. If it is not
present on the resource, then can update the resource directly using
the resource's URI.

commit_message:
Introduce BIOS API

Add `system` resource to have reference to `bios`.

Support patching via @Redfish.Settings settings object resource
using new SettingsField.

SettingsField is a reusable field that corresponds to
@Redfish.Settings in other resources.

This SettingsField corresponds to Settings.v1_0_0 field schema, newer
versions introduce additional fields that will be added later.
Also at least iDRAC does not support anything newer than
Settings.v1_0_0 field schema now.

In the unit tests, settings.json contains imaginary values for Message,
Severity, MessageArgs and Resolution fields as could not find existing
samples holding these fields.

@Redfish.Settings is a special field (annotation) that does not appear
as a property in any schemas of Redfish resources.
Theoretically it can be present in any resource.
Practically this field is added to resources that support future state
of the resource where immediate application of updates is not possible
and need to restart system or a service for the values to take effect.
So far it has been identified that resources that can have this field
are: BIOS, Ethernet Interface and Storage.
If @Redfish.Settings is present on the resource, then need to use URI
in its subfield SettingsObject to update resource. If it is not
present on the resource, then can update the resource directly using
the resource's URI.

Change-Id: Ib2ef3d6380975ec7b964ebb634575e2b86d51991
Task: 12508
Story: 2001791

added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # This is referred from Redfish standard schema. # http://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/v1/Settings.v1_0_0.json from sushy.resources import base class SettingsObjectField(base.CompositeField): """Reference to the resource for updating settings""" resource_uri = base.Field('@odata.id') """URI of the resource to which a client must do a PUT or PATCH in order to modify this resource """ class MessageListField(base.ListField): message_id = base.Field('MessageId') """The key for this message which can be used to look up the message in a message registry """ message = base.Field('Message') """Human readable message, if provided""" severity = base.Field('Severity') """Severity of the errors""" resolution = base.Field('Resolution') """Used to provide suggestions on how to resolve the situation that caused the error """ related_properties = base.Field('RelatedProperties') """List of properties described by the message""" message_args = base.Field('MessageArgs') """List of message arguments are substituted for the arguments in the message when looked up in the message registry """ class SettingsField(base.CompositeField): """The settings of a resource Represents the future state and configuration of the resource. For resources that support a future state and configuration, the response shall contain a property with the "@Redfish.Settings" annotation. It includes several properties to help clients monitor when the resource is consumed by the service and determine the results of applying the values, which may or may not have been successful. """ time = base.Field('Time') """Indicates the time the settings were applied""" etag = base.Field('ETag') """The ETag of the resource to which the settings were applied, after the application """ settings_object = SettingsObjectField('SettingsObject') """Reference to the resource the client may PUT/PATCH to in order to change this resource""" messages = MessageListField("Messages") """Represent the results of the last time the values of the Settings resource were applied"""

commit_message:
add --task-per option to import-goal

Using --task-per repo results in one task for every repository. The
default is --task-per project which gives one task for each project.

Change-Id: I2dc3b85ce4fd866436ac7d2d924392c80d9de142
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
add configuration option to disable certificate verification

the storyboard-dev.openstack.org server doesn't have a valid cert (at
least according to requests) so we need to be able to disable
certificate validation

Change-Id: Ia7cd203097d5e8886501795c998b751d9b7601ef
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

This will make it easier to reuse.

commit_message:
Add 'openstack-db' tag to db-sync Exec resource

In order to make easy orchestration on all OpenStack db-sync, add this
tag so people can use this tag in composition layer.
A use case it to set some orchestration to make sure MySQL Galera is
ready before running any Exec with this tag.

Change-Id: I800fd9a00ddf7e7ca0ebd54c9d203cf04477aa3b
Closes-Bug: #1755102
(cherry picked from commit d595457836a82a20b18573b085b166d396bdba1a)

added_lines: domain(s) for example, via ``virsh``.You should set up your systemd to launch the ``vbmcd`` server on system start up or you can just run ``vbmcd`` from command line if you do not need the tool running persistently on the system. Once the server is up and running, you can use the ``vbmc`` tool to configure your libvirt domains as if they were physical hardware servers. The ``vbmc`` client can only communicate with ``vbmcd`` server if both are running on the same host. However ``vbmcd`` can manage libvirt domains remotely. Alternatively, libvirt can be configured to ssh into a remote machine and manage libvirt domain through ssh connection: $ vbmc add node-1 --port 6230 \ --libvirt-uri qemu+ssh://username@192.168.122.1/system node-1 .. note:: .. warning:: The backward compabible behaviour will be removed in two-cycle time past Queens.

commit_message:
Remove the dist_sort module

The dist_sort module is no longer used anywhere, so there's no need to
keep it around.

Change-Id: Idb492e01aa82a3f55b28565fb77a4f7cd7a9d735
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-plugins refs/changes/69/575469/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: #!/usr/bin/env python # (c) 2014, Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com> # # Copyright 2014, Rackspace US, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. # import module snippets from ansible.module_utils.basic import * DOCUMENTATION = """ --- module: dist_sort version_added: "1.6.6" short_description: - Deterministically sort a list to distribute the elements in the list evenly. Based on external values such as host or static modifier. Returns a string as named key ``sorted_list``. description: - This module returns a list of servers uniquely sorted based on a index from a look up value location within a group. The group should be an existing ansible inventory group. This will module returns the sorted list as a delimited string. options: src_list: description: - list in the form of a string separated by a delimiter. required: True ref_list: description: - list to lookup value_to_lookup against to return index number This should be a pre-determined ansible group containing the ``value_to_lookup``. required: False value_to_lookup: description: - value is looked up against ref_list to get index number. required: False sort_modifier: description: - add a static int into the sort equation to weight the output. type: int default: 0 delimiter: description: - delimiter used to parse ``src_list`` with. default: ',' author: - Kevin Carter - Sam Yaple """ EXAMPLES = """ - dist_sort: value_to_lookup: "Hostname-in-ansible-group_name" ref_list: "{{ groups['group_name'] }}" src_list: "Server1,Server2,Server3" register: test_var # With a pre-set delimiter - dist_sort: value_to_lookup: "Hostname-in-ansible-group_name" ref_list: "{{ groups['group_name'] }}" src_list: "Server1|Server2|Server3" delimiter: '|' register: test_var # With a set modifier - dist_sort: value_to_lookup: "Hostname-in-ansible-group_name" ref_list: "{{ groups['group_name'] }}" src_list: "Server1#Server2#Server3" delimiter: '#' sort_modifier: 5 register: test_var """ class DistSort(object): def __init__(self, module): """Deterministically sort a list of servers. :param module: The active ansible module. :type module: ``class`` """ self.module = module self.params = self.module.params self.return_data = self._runner() def _runner(self): """Return the sorted list of servers. Based on the modulo of index of a *value_to_lookup* from an ansible group this function will return a comma "delimiter" separated list of items. :returns: ``str`` """ try: index = self.params['ref_list'].index( self.params['value_to_lookup'] ) except ValueError: index = 0 src_list = self.params['src_list'].split(self.params['delimiter']) index += self.params['sort_modifier'] for _ in range(index % len(src_list)): src_list.append(src_list.pop(0)) return self.params['delimiter'].join(src_list) def main(): """Run the main app.""" module = AnsibleModule( argument_spec=dict( value_to_lookup=dict( required=True, type='str' ), ref_list=dict( required=True, type='list' ), src_list=dict( required=True, type='str' ), delimiter=dict( required=False, type='str', default=',' ), sort_modifier=dict( required=False, type='str', default='0' ) ), supports_check_mode=False ) try: # This is done so that the failure can be parsed and does not cause # ansible to fail if a non-int is passed. module.params['sort_modifier'] = int(module.params['sort_modifier']) _ds = DistSort(module=module) if _ds.return_data == module.params['src_list']: _changed = False else: _changed = True except Exception as exp: resp = {'stderr': str(exp)} resp.update(module.params) module.fail_json(msg='Failed Process', **resp) else: module.exit_json(changed=_changed, **{'sorted_list': _ds.return_data}) if __name__ == '__main__': main()

commit_message:
Switch to using stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1] stestr is
maintained project to which all Openstack projects
should migrate.
Let's switch it then.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: Ide9493cf06b7af03324d46d673047b8ada354e5e
Signed-off-by: Charles Short <zulcss@gmail.com>

subject: Fix connection plugin for Ansible 2.5
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-22 00:39:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-plugins/commit/941ea9f28148b126385e647ceaba1eb0bc6fd4af', 'message': "Fix setting of physical_host_addrs

For 'physical_host_addrs' to be able to be looked up by the connection
plugin it will need to be included in the 'task_vars' dictionary which
is eventually passed to the task executor.

Change-Id: I16bc76f17ae5d2da4803fd7cdcdcfe72e77f9df1
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-06-22 07:57:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-plugins/commit/2147aa844f352c3e9391b7f719c5c085eb536927', 'message': "Fix setting of physical_host_addrs

For 'physical_host_addrs' to be able to be looked up by the connection
plugin it will need to be included in the 'task_vars' dictionary which
is eventually passed to the task executor. Moreover, we remove the now
obsoleted[1] 'set_host_overrides' function and also check whether a task
is delegated on the container itself so we do not try to ssh to it.

[1]: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/commit/23b1dbacaf8a20f7147de0f67f8d6c67de2142ef
Co-Authored-By: Markos Chandras <mchandras@suse.de>
Change-Id: I16bc76f17ae5d2da4803fd7cdcdcfe72e77f9df1
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2018-06-22 08:22:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-plugins/commit/5637c3c44e92c907578dce2e3082e4d2957281ce', 'message': "Fix setting of physical_host_addrs

For 'physical_host_addrs' to be able to be looked up by the connection
plugin it will need to be included in the 'task_vars' dictionary which
is eventually passed to the task executor. Moreover, we remove the now
obsoleted[1] 'set_host_overrides' function and also use the 'host'
attribute to determine if the host that executes the task is the same
as the physical_host and decide whether we are going to connect to a
container or not.

If the 'container_name' variable is available, it should take precedence

of a host variable and, when it is available, the connection plugin's
shell is initialized with a system writable temp directory to avoid
requiring additional privileges for the user.

against 'ansible_host'. If these match, the container is only known by
an IP address and will require a direct SSH connection.

commit_message:
Fix connection plugin for Ansible 2.5

For 'physical_host_addrs' to be able to be looked up by the connection
plugin it will need to be included in the 'task_vars' dictionary which
is eventually passed to the task executor. Moreover, we remove the now
obsoleted[1] 'set_host_overrides' function.

If the 'container_name' variable is available, it should take precedence
over 'inventory_hostname' for determining a container's name.

The 'container_user' variable is now set through 'set_options' instead
of a host variable and, when it is available, the connection plugin's
shell is initialized with a system writable temp directory to avoid
requiring additional privileges for the user.

The container check has been updated to also check 'container_name'
against 'ansible_host'. If these match, the container is only known by
an IP address and will require a direct SSH connection.

[1]: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/commit/23b1dbacaf8a20f7147de0f67f8d6c67de2142ef
Co-Authored-By: Markos Chandras <mchandras@suse.de>
Change-Id: I16bc76f17ae5d2da4803fd7cdcdcfe72e77f9df1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-plugins refs/changes/30/577330/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: task_vars['physical_host_addrs'] = physical_host_addrs
deleted_lines: host.set_variable('physical_host_addrs', physical_host_addrs)

commit_message:
Add 'openstack-db' tag to db-sync Exec resource

In order to make easy orchestration on all OpenStack db-sync, add this
tag so people can use this tag in composition layer.
A use case it to set some orchestration to make sure MySQL Galera is
ready before running any Exec with this tag.

Change-Id: I8215df855b260b9421df121d136be2e77eab1346
Closes-Bug: #1755102
(cherry picked from commit d4113232558e9cb7a385a812e31453d36086b5ef)

commit_message:
Network: Add tag support for security group

Change-Id: Icccb23429913724c6a8bd15d4737672b47a5f13a
Closes-Bug: #1750983
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/33/547733/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from osc_lib.command import commandfrom openstackclient.network.v2 import _tag _tag.add_tag_option_to_parser_for_create(parser, _('security group')) # tags cannot be set when created, so tags need to be set later. _tag.update_tags_for_set(client, obj, parsed_args) _tag.add_tag_filtering_option_to_parser(parser, _('security group')) _tag.get_tag_filtering_args(parsed_args, filters) "Project ID", "tags" "Project", "Tags" def update_parser_network(self, parser): _tag.add_tag_option_to_parser_for_set(parser, _('security group')) return parser # tags is a subresource and it needs to be updated separately. _tag.update_tags_for_set(client, obj, parsed_args) class UnsetSecurityGroup(command.Command): _description = _("Unset security group properties") def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(UnsetSecurityGroup, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument( 'group', metavar="<group>", help=_("Security group to display (name or ID)") ) _tag.add_tag_option_to_parser_for_unset(parser, _('security group')) return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): client = self.app.client_manager.network obj = client.find_security_group(parsed_args.group, ignore_missing=False) # tags is a subresource and it needs to be updated separately. _tag.update_tags_for_unset(client, obj, parsed_args)
deleted_lines: "Project ID" "Project"

commit_message:

commit_message:
support hpe device type for the HPE 5900 series switches

To enable vlan configuration of HPE 5900 series switches that use
comware5 netconf.

Change-Id: I5a5a60f3e5af1ec9e23609fe491345f10daee110

building from source.

subject: Ensure resource class cache when listing usages
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-11 16:20:18.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/resource_provider.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/6e1dd287f18e03428b6f991c5b4bdd66901f8c2d', 'message': "Ensure resource class cache when listing usages

In rare circumstances it is possible to list usages in a new placement
process that has not yet instantiated the _RC_CACHE but for which
there are inventories and allocations in the database (added by
other processes running against the same db). Before this change
that would cause a 500 error (AttributeError) when the Usage objects
in the UsageList were instantiated.

The fix is to added _ensure_rc_cache to the two list methods. The
addition is done there rather than in the _from_db_object as the
latter would cause a lot of redundant checks.

While we could probably devise a test for this, it's perhaps good
enough to evaluate the change by inspection. If not, suggestions
welcome.

Change-Id: I00f7dee26f031366dbc0d3d6a03abe89afeb85fd
Closes-Bug: #1775308
(cherry picked from commit 724d440122232a5bfdfec51eb0d37ca4f1d748d8)
(cherry picked from commit 79a1a113775df87d420b242cea4bbf953df3779c)
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure resource class cache when listing usages

In rare circumstances it is possible to list usages in a new placement
process that has not yet instantiated the _RC_CACHE but for which
there are inventories and allocations in the database (added by
other processes running against the same db). Before this change
that would cause a 500 error (AttributeError) when the Usage objects
in the UsageList were instantiated.

The fix is to added _ensure_rc_cache to the two list methods. The
addition is done there rather than in the _from_db_object as the
latter would cause a lot of redundant checks.

While we could probably devise a test for this, it's perhaps good
enough to evaluate the change by inspection. If not, suggestions
welcome.

Change-Id: I00f7dee26f031366dbc0d3d6a03abe89afeb85fd
Closes-Bug: #1775308
(cherry picked from commit 724d440122232a5bfdfec51eb0d37ca4f1d748d8)
(cherry picked from commit 79a1a113775df87d420b242cea4bbf953df3779c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/27/574327/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: _ensure_rc_cache(context) _ensure_rc_cache(context)

commit_message:
Switch to providing created_at field for servers

All of the current models return the creation date in created_at
with the exception of servers which are currently returned with
a created field instead.

This patch addresses this and gives the ability to get access to
both.

Change-Id: Ifbd59834080eea62dead19d18a9a11a851a4ce2e

commit_message:
Add CentOS extras repository inside containers

There are a few useful and important packages which are provided
by the `extras` repository that are needed by things like Percona
for example libuv.

There is no reported issues in terms of compatibility between the
extras repositories and RDO.  As a matter of fact, CentOS release
packages are all located in there so you can't get started with
the cloud SIG packages without it anyways.

In addition, we'll be storing the repo information in a specific
file in order to avoid having to do the shell-out and manually
changing attributes in a weird way.

Change-Id: I3df2c670beeb78baaa1515bcd27e8f2b0d95b3a9

commit_message:
Remove volume client and usage in scenario tests

We don't need the volume/Cinder client in our scenario
tests, nor the methods that it was currently being
used in. Remove its usage from the base class to
unblock https://review.openstack.org/#/c/573135/

Change-Id: I111c648280912fcbad671cc27cf87c496e8689ba
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/573135/

commit_message:
Consolidate member role to standard

With the latest change to keystone regarding default roles, this
change moves all instances of the member role to be set as
"member", from any deviations in casing or characters.

Change-Id: I9f49fb562239047763c88fcb09a13d891b80d60a

commit_message:
includes options defined in kafka common

The generated sample config did not include common kafka options
specified in kafka_common.py.
This was resolved by appending these options along with options
unique to the kafka metric-topic/alarm-topic

Change-Id: I3d765e9bdef0cfac186ebb9bddd97a7336076794
story: 2002649
task: 22355

commit_message:
Gate: fix dns port collision

This PS updates the dnsmasq pod that runs in the gate to allow vm's
API access to only bind to br-ex, as otherwise it collides with other
DNS servers running in the gates.

Change-Id: I85bb3043d56689ad8ee2996df61d23969a535de1

commit_message:
Propose 1.2.0 release

Change-Id: Ic8bb4c725144386b128f9419afe256c17f295d3a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally-openstack refs/changes/22/577822/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [1.2.0] - 2018-05-25 -------------------- Rally 1.0.0 has released. This is a major release which doesn't contain in-tree OpenStack plugins. Also, this release extends flexibility of validating required platforms which means that logic of required admin/users for the plugin can be implemented at **rally-openstack** side and this is done in rally-openstack 1.2.0 Changed ~~~~~~~ Also, it is sad to mention, but due to OpenStack policies we need to stop duplicating release notes at ``git tag message``. At least for now.

commit_message:
Add Elasticsearch image with s3 repository plugin

This introduces an image that extends the elasticsearch:5.6.4
image to include the s3 repository plugin, allowing us to use the
s3 api for radosgw to support elasticsearch's snapshot repository
functionality

Change-Id: I9cd4a4442ace48ea8615dd57da3ebc744956ca64
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm refs/changes/25/573425/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: FROM elasticsearch:5.6.4 RUN elasticsearch-plugin install repository-s3

commit_message:
add validation for xstatic package versions

The git tag must match the version information inside the package.

Change-Id: I04e54fc8870cab5f24f44be65255990d4e7cf8dd
Story: #2002686
Task: #22509
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/35/577835/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import glob import logging import os.path LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) def get_metadata(workdir, repo): "Load the package.json file from the repo" pattern = os.path.join(workdir, repo, 'xstatic/pkg/*') LOG.debug('scanning %s for packages', pattern) packages = [ n for n in glob.glob(pattern) if os.path.isdir(n) ] if len(packages) > 1: raise ValueError('Found multiple packages: {}'.format(packages)) if not packages: raise ValueError('Found no xstatic packages in {}'.format(repo)) module_name = os.path.join(packages[0], '__init__.py') LOG.debug('reading %s', module_name) with open(module_name, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: body = f.read() local_vars = {} global_vars = { '__file__': module_name, '__name__': os.path.basename(os.path.dirname(module_name)), } exec(body, global_vars, local_vars) LOG.debug(global_vars) LOG.debug(local_vars) return local_vars def get_version(workdir, repo): "Get the version string from the project metadata." return get_metadata(workdir, repo).get('PACKAGE_VERSION')

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-22 20:25:16.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_common/inventory.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/870d77dea43c1f86f9641045bbbd9e20c0587337', 'message': 'Set ANSIBLE_REMOTE_TMP for undercloud group

Set a group_var for undercloud nodes that configures the remote tmp file
for Ansible to use $HOME from the environment. This worked unintentionally in
Ansible < 2.5.4 and was changed in
https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/36755.

Setting this explicitly using the recommended variable to ensure this works
reliably.

Related Ansible issue: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/41808

Change-Id: I21a99a579fcc25f37d1f1d9d6b98bd7b5bf3a35a
'}]
commit_message:
Set ANSIBLE_REMOTE_TMP for undercloud group

Set a group_var for undercloud nodes that configures the remote tmp file
for Ansible to use $HOME from the environment. This worked unintentionally in
Ansible < 2.5.4 and was changed in
https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/36755.

Setting this explicitly using the recommended variable to ensure this works
reliably.

Related Ansible issue: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/41808

Change-Id: I21a99a579fcc25f37d1f1d9d6b98bd7b5bf3a35a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/50/577550/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'ansible_remote_tmp': '$HOME/.ansible/tmp',

commit_message:
Fix conductor manager unit tests

This fixes some of the conductor-manager's unit tests; mostly the
cleaning-related ones. Some of the mocking was incorrect (e.g.
mocked calls), because 'autospec=True' was not specified.

Change-Id: I0b7988818e0ea72328bcc246ab22d2094d233444

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Conflicts:
	tox.ini

Change-Id: I984feb279774895efbe587b962afeda882c55e65
(cherry picked from commit 5ebee30934fb086c69adc52d0643e913d00311e1)

subject: Gate fix: Cap hacking to avoid gate failure
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-25 09:56:32.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sushy/commit/b3f4b7501f5b1ad92c4e2d39e63dd7b692ccd538', 'message': 'Gate fix: Cap hacking to avoid gate failure

hacking is not capped in g-r and it is in
blacklist for requirement as hacking new version
can break the gate jobs.

Hacking can break gate jobs because of various
reasons:
- There might be new rule addition in hacking
- Some rules becomes default from non-default
- Updates in pycodestyle etc

That was the main reason it was not added in g-r
auto sync also. Most of the project maintained the
compatible and cap the hacking version in
test-requirements.txt and update to new version when
project is ready. Bumping new version might need code
fix also on project side depends on what new in that
version.

If project does not have cap the hacking version then,
there is possibility of gate failure whenever new hacking
version is released by QA team.

Example of such failure in recent release of hacking 1.1.0
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-May/130282.html

The following is not the part of the stable cherry-pick:
Also fixes the lower-constraints file to allow the CI to pass.

Change-Id: I7d61303c145784c86d95ccc5cd58f4ced376a713
(cherry picked from commit fc012cb706540c5f72709ebdc4d284021c8e3141)
'}]
commit_message:
Gate fix: Cap hacking to avoid gate failure

hacking is not capped in g-r and it is in
blacklist for requirement as hacking new version
can break the gate jobs.

Hacking can break gate jobs because of various
reasons:
- There might be new rule addition in hacking
- Some rules becomes default from non-default
- Updates in pycodestyle etc

That was the main reason it was not added in g-r
auto sync also. Most of the project maintained the
compatible and cap the hacking version in
test-requirements.txt and update to new version when
project is ready. Bumping new version might need code
fix also on project side depends on what new in that
version.

If project does not have cap the hacking version then,
there is possibility of gate failure whenever new hacking
version is released by QA team.

Example of such failure in recent release of hacking 1.1.0
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-May/130282.html

The following is not the part of the stable cherry-pick:
Also fixes the lower-constraints file to allow the CI to pass.

Change-Id: I7d61303c145784c86d95ccc5cd58f4ced376a713
(cherry picked from commit fc012cb706540c5f72709ebdc4d284021c8e3141)

commit_message:
Be graceful about vif plugging in early ironic driver startup

During ironic driver startup, we re-plug VIFs (for potentially
dubious reasons). If we're racing with ironic startup, which is
likely on single-node (i.e. undercloud) installations, we will
attempt to do the plug and can fail because no ironic conductors
are available to do the job. It sounds like ironic should be
returning 500 in this case, and maybe the long-term solution is
to do that and have ironicclient manage the retry for us.

For the moment, ironic shows its hand in the message, indicating
the conductor reasoning. This patch makes us retry for up to a
minute waiting for that to clear, before actually failing.

Conflicts:
    nova/tests/unit/virt/ironic/test_driver.py

NOTE(lyarwood): Test conflict due to _get_cached_node being
introduced in Rocky by Id96e7e513f469b87992ddae1431cce714e91ed16.

Change-Id: I6450ceb54bd85945b76d3ac46882e1fea6b82742
Related-Bug: #1777475
(cherry picked from commit 07f027d2b068caa1ebde81e476ce01f55a0fa5b1)

commit_message:
Remove the ilo classic drivers

This removes pxe_ilo, iscsi_ilo and agent_ilo. Also removed is
the whole documentation section dedicated to them.

commit_message:
Add py36 testenv

Python 3.6 is installed by default in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS.
Therefore, according to transition plan [1],
we should have py36 testenv ready for it.

[1] https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Python/Python36Transition

Change-Id: I41723a6fed6946af11dc5c639f2529e8c12972be

commit_message:
Trivial: Update pypi url to new url

Pypi url changed from [1] to [2]

[1] https://pypi.python.org/pypi/<package>
[2] https://pypi.org/project/<package>

Co-Authored-By: Nguyen Hai <nguyentrihai93@gmail.com>
Change-Id: If929fa84942bfbc0a0fc68489fba53dbdd5e42ca
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/85/563385/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pypi = xmlrpclib.ServerProxy('https://pypi.org/project')
deleted_lines: pypi = xmlrpclib.ServerProxy('https://pypi.python.org/pypi')

subject: Bump setuptool to 39.2.0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-16 21:47:49.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirement-pins.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/c21a2c0a9c7eeeb1bb9de861cb11c4d15b0f1723', 'message': 'Bump setuptool to 39.2.0

There has been some reported issues with installation of some
packages with the current pinned release so hopefully getting
up on a newer one will resolve some of those issues.

Change-Id: I187b0d5e1d8f3fd0fd03da5c50d17a9463d5dc4b
'}]
commit_message:
Bump setuptool to 39.2.0

There has been some reported issues with installation of some
packages with the current pinned release so hopefully getting
up on a newer one will resolve some of those issues.

Change-Id: I187b0d5e1d8f3fd0fd03da5c50d17a9463d5dc4b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/35/575935/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: setuptools==39.2.0
deleted_lines: setuptools==39.0.1

subject: Allow passing multiple VIFs to CNI
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-05 15:22:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes/commit/40ef8b8ace62b289e44eb751266fd4975bf33398', 'message': "Allow passing multiple VIFs to CNI

This commit alters the format of the annotation, set and read by
controller/CNI. Instead of a single VIF object it now holds a
dictionary, that maps interface names to VIF objects. Controller
currently only sets 'eth0' as the default VIF. The CNI is altered
accordingly to read VIFs from the mapping and add all of them to Pods
namespace.

This commit does not include any mechanism to actually request multiple
IPs/ports for a Pod, but rather lays foundation for future commits, that
would allow that.

Related bp: kuryr-kubernetes-sriov-support
Targets bp: multi-vif-pods

Change-Id: Iaef928e7ab9dc0fce8b7e8fffb7b5a1f6b5ccb17

"}, {'number': 13, 'created': '2017-07-17 11:09:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes/commit/8aa68587acfaca04c388496ddbe2425ad5a61dd0', 'message': "Allow passing multiple VIFs to CNI

This commit alters the format of the annotation, set/read by
controller/CNI. Instead of a single VIF object it now holds a
dictionary, that maps interface names to VIF objects. Controller
currently only sets 'eth0' as the default VIF. The CNI is altered
accordingly to read VIFs from the mapping and add all of them to Pods
namespace. It would now wait for all VIFs on the Pod to become active
before calling the callback.

This commit does not include any mechanism to actually request multiple
IPs/ports for a Pod, but rather lays foundation for future commits, that
would allow that.

Related bp: kuryr-kubernetes-sriov-support
Targets bp: multi-vif-pods

Change-Id: Iaef928e7ab9dc0fce8b7e8fffb7b5a1f6b5ccb17

commit_message:
Allow passing multiple VIFs to CNI

This commit alters the format of the annotation, set and read by
controller/CNI. Instead of a single VIF object it now holds a
dictionary, that maps interface names to VIF objects. Controller
currently only sets 'eth0' as the default VIF. The CNI is altered
accordingly to read VIFs from the mapping and add all of them to Pods
namespace.

This commit does not include any mechanism to actually request multiple
IPs/ports for a Pod, but rather lays foundation for future commits, that
would allow that.

Related bp: kuryr-kubernetes-sriov-support
Targets bp: multi-vif-pods

Change-Id: Iaef928e7ab9dc0fce8b7e8fffb7b5a1f6b5ccb17
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes refs/changes/12/471012/42 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self._vifs = {} self.ready = True vifs = self._get_vifs(pod) self.ready = True for ifname, vif in vifs.items(): self.on_vif(pod, vif, ifname) if self.ready: callback_vif = None if self._cni.CNI_IFNAME in self._vifs: callback_vif = self._vifs[self._cni.CNI_IFNAME] elif self._vifs: callback_vif = self._vifs.values()[0] self._callback(callback_vif) def on_vif(self, pod, vif, ifname): def _get_vifs(self, pod): return {} vifs_dict = jsonutils.loads(vif_annotation) vifs_dict = { ifname: obj_vif.vif.VIFBase.obj_from_primitive(vif) for ifname, vif in vifs_dict.items() } LOG.debug("Got VIF from annotation: %r", vifs_dict) return vifs_dict def on_vif(self, pod, vif, ifname): if ifname not in self._vifs: self._vifs[ifname] = vif _vif = vif.obj_clone() _vif.active = True default_gateway = (ifname == self._cni.CNI_IFNAME) b_base.connect(_vif, self._get_inst(pod), ifname, self._cni.CNI_NETNS, default_gateway) # at least one vif is not active, should hold off the CNI if not vif.active: self.ready = False def on_vif(self, pod, vif, ifname):
deleted_lines: self._vif = None vif = self._get_vif(pod) if vif: self.on_vif(pod, vif) def on_vif(self, pod, vif): def _get_vif(self, pod): return None vif_dict = jsonutils.loads(vif_annotation) vif = obj_vif.vif.VIFBase.obj_from_primitive(vif_dict) LOG.debug("Got VIF from annotation: %r", vif) return vif self._vif = None def on_vif(self, pod, vif): if not self._vif: self._vif = vif.obj_clone() self._vif.active = True b_base.connect(self._vif, self._get_inst(pod), self._cni.CNI_IFNAME, self._cni.CNI_NETNS) if vif.active: self._callback(vif) def on_vif(self, pod, vif): self._callback(vif)

commit_message:
Add Docker support

Add support for running dragonflow as a docker container.

Includes documentation how to set up with OVS running on the host.

Change-Id: Ia7185ea7f9d47a56853def418aeab8c3a4e87d0a
Resolves-Bug: #1778007

added_lines: Building the image ------------------ * Run the following command .. code-block:: bash docker build --tag dragonflow . Running the image ----------------- Preparation work ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ * Create a network to be used by the containers .. code-block:: bash docker network create --subnet=172.18.0.0/16 dragonflow_net Running etcd node ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ * Run the following commands: .. code-block:: bash mkdir -p /tmp/etcd chcon -Rt svirt_sandbox_file_t /tmp/etcd export NODE1=172.18.0.2 export DATA_DIR=/tmp/etcd docker run --detach -p 2379:2379 -p 2380:2380 --net dragonflow_net --ip ${NODE1} --volume=${DATA_DIR}:/etcd-data --name etcd quay.io/coreos/etcd:latest /usr/local/bin/etcd --data-dir=/etcd-data --name node1 --initial-advertise-peer-urls http://${NODE1}:2380 --listen-peer-urls http://${NODE1}:2380 --advertise-client-urls http://${NODE1}:2379 --listen-client-urls http://${NODE1}:2379 --initial-cluster node1=http://${NODE1}:2380 * Make sure the IP was properly assigned to the container: .. code-block:: bash docker inspect etcd | grep "IPAddress" Running controller node ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ * Run the following commands: .. code-block:: bash export DRAGONFLOW_ADDRESS=172.18.0.3 docker run --name dragonflow --net dragonflow_net --ip ${DRAGONFLOW_ADDRESS} dragonflow:latest --dragonflow_address ${DRAGONFLOW_ADDRESS} --db_address ${NODE1}:2379 * Make sure the IP was properly assigned to the container: .. code-block:: bash docker inspect etcd | grep "IPAddress"

commit_message:
Update os_neutron role SHA for OVS fix

OVS deployments are currently broken due to a missing default
value for neutron_ovs_service_name.

This patch brings the role SHA forward to include [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/568360

Change-Id: Iff8b2927ba524ebf5b00c16d67aae624fdfe318b
Closes-Bug: 1771200

commit_message:
Allow api_version_request.matches to accept a string or None

According to the Manila devref you should be able to use the following
pattern:

if req_version.matches("2.1", "2.5"):
    ....stuff....
elif req_version.matches("2.6", "2.10"):
    ....other stuff....
elif req_version > api_version_request.APIVersionRequest("2.10"):
    ....more stuff.....

However, the api_version_request.matches() function will not accept a
string, it requires an api_version_request object.

Fix this to accept a string, as well as None for object.

Change-Id: Ic2faaaa7696cc7a647679cbb7a8600b30c3d66d7
Closes-Bug: 1550337

added_lines: if isinstance(min_version, str): min_version = APIVersionRequest(version_string=min_version) if isinstance(max_version, str): max_version = APIVersionRequest(version_string=max_version) if not min_version and not max_version: elif not max_version or max_version.is_null(): elif not min_version or min_version.is_null(): elif max_version.is_null() and min_version.is_null(): return True
deleted_lines: if max_version.is_null() and min_version.is_null(): elif max_version.is_null(): elif min_version.is_null():

commit_message:
Fix centos opstools repo deactivation

The repo name and the variable were wrong, with this
fix by default opstool is not installed, not it was installed.
Also looks like the opstool deps breaks tripleo.

Closes-Bug: 1778040

Change-Id: Ibd6cd439ef2c297ed420b96ea40bd71ebcab6fd6

commit_message:
Nimble: Fix tuple being passed for exception init

Rather than formatting a string to pass as the exception initialization
it was passing in a tuple of the format string and value. This changes
it to perform the string formatting correctly.

Also fixes up a whitespace issue in one of the other exception strings.

Change-Id: I12648a8806bdbb3ef7933d3f256a2c0213219302

commit_message:
Create tests package for keystone and glance

Exclude tests from python package, instead create
a new subpackage to ship tests for keystone and glance.

Also Fix:
[keystone] username:- %{keystone} --> keystone
[glance] api package dependency on base package

Change-Id: I65d8e5de9f524ed09aa306a8ab82d3117c1b6e27
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rpm-packaging refs/changes/64/577364/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: %package -n python-{{ pypi_name }}-tests Summary: Glance tests Requires: openstack-{{ pypi_name }} = %{epoch}:%{version}-%{release} %description -n python-{{ pypi_name }}-tests The Glance project provides a service where users can upload and discover data assets that are meant to be used with other services. This currently includes images and metadata definitions. Glance image services include discovering, registering, and retrieving virtual machine images. Glance has a RESTful API that allows querying of VM image metadata as well as retrieval of the actual image. VM images made available through Glance can be stored in a variety of locations from simple filesystems to object-storage systems like the OpenStack Swift project. This package contains the Glance test files. %exclude %{python3_sitelib}/glance/tests %files -n python-{{ pypi_name }}-tests %license LICENSE %{python3_sitelib}/{{ pypi_name }}/tests

commit_message:
Be graceful about vif plugging in early ironic driver startup

During ironic driver startup, we re-plug VIFs (for potentially
dubious reasons). If we're racing with ironic startup, which is
likely on single-node (i.e. undercloud) installations, we will
attempt to do the plug and can fail because no ironic conductors
are available to do the job. It sounds like ironic should be
returning 500 in this case, and maybe the long-term solution is
to do that and have ironicclient manage the retry for us.

For the moment, ironic shows its hand in the message, indicating
the conductor reasoning. This patch makes us retry for up to a
minute waiting for that to clear, before actually failing.

Change-Id: I6450ceb54bd85945b76d3ac46882e1fea6b82742
Related-Bug: #1777475

commit_message:
Import Zuul setting from project-config

All projects are moving their Zuul configs from the
openstack-infra/project-config repo to their local repos. Once this change
has been backported to all open stable branches, we can remove the
centralised config.

translation-jobs-queens is omitted because we will set that up on the
stable/queens branch specifically (in place of translation-jobs, which runs
only on master).

Change-Id: Ia182e4dcf1a0b8e3af124b6676b20e6adb55f76b

commit_message:
Enable Swift multinode grenade testing

As Swift is aiming to add multinode grenade rolling upgrade test. The
goal here is to disable specific services on primary
and/or subnode and test compatibility.

This introduces a new features.yaml element that would
disable s-proxy on primary node. This will be required for Swift
multinode grenade jobs that will test compatibility
of master s-account, s-container, s-object
with stable s-proxy.

Also in devstack-gate-vm.sh the storage node needs to be
identified for configuration.  In this case that node is
the primary node.

Change-Id: I4681518b0142da1d43c1d090e30a3e7ec696d2b9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/80/411980/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: swift_mn_grenade: features: [swift-mn-grenade] # This will be used to disable s-proxy on primary node when running multinode grenade # job that will test compatibility of new s-account, s-container, s-object (primary) and old s-proxy (sub). swift-mn-grenade: base: rm-services: [s-proxy] swift-mn-grenade: base: services: []

commit_message:
Reintroduce testr slowest after tempest run

This commit reintroduces the testr slowest call after the tempest run to
print the slowest tests from the job. This was recently reverted in
change Ibde5417d005265d27e939ca29788c21f73b38980 because of an issue
when running tempest with system site packages enabled where the testr
binary wasn't in the venv. This is because the testrepository python
package is always system installed, and it's how we collect subunit data
from all runs in the cleanup functions. So now instead of assuming it's
present in a tox venv from tempest, it just calls the system version.

Change-Id: I5d07b49c5b428b1c92d990e7cc822a3483d39689
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/25/442125/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sudo -H -u tempest testr slowest
deleted_lines: if [[ "$DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_ALL_PLUGINS" -eq "1" ]]; then sudo -H -u tempest .tox/all-plugin/bin/testr slowest else sudo -H -u tempest .tox/tempest/bin/testr slowest fi

commit_message:
Create baremetal flavor and sets it in tempest's bm section

Ironic started to use devstack plugin. That caused a bug cause there was
no away to run stack phases on the ironic plugin before tempest cause
tempest is in-tree service right now, and thus tempest stop honoring the
DEFAULT_INSTANCE_TYPE=baremetal set on ironic jobs.

This change aims, along w/ I3bdf46afc4c67433cd66bee7aed278f51b544941, in
tempest, and I7bd7e34bb182ecc3edc4d334b84f75f673d9814c, in ironic, to fix
that by moving the baremetal flavor creation into lib/tempest (which makes
sense since it's a resource that tempest uses, not ironic) and introducing
a new option in tempest: baremetal.instance_type (similar idea already
exists for heat).

Change-Id: I59b72e0acb745c86302eca4d770e4c9140c09ee1
Partial-bug: #1546706
Depends-on: I5edc51c7fc8b6f0bb7fe4ca129596709a32eb93e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/03/281503/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ $IRONIC_IS_HARDWARE == "True" ]; then local ironic_node_cpu=$IRONIC_HW_NODE_CPU local ironic_node_ram=$IRONIC_HW_NODE_RAM local ironic_node_disk=$IRONIC_HW_NODE_DISK local ironic_ephemeral_disk=$IRONIC_HW_EPHEMERAL_DISK local ironic_node_arch=$IRONIC_HW_ARCH else local ironic_node_cpu=$IRONIC_VM_SPECS_CPU local ironic_node_ram=$IRONIC_VM_SPECS_RAM local ironic_node_disk=$IRONIC_VM_SPECS_DISK local ironic_ephemeral_disk=$IRONIC_VM_EPHEMERAL_DISK local ironic_node_arch=x86_64 fi local adjusted_disk adjusted_disk=$(($ironic_node_disk - $ironic_ephemeral_disk)) nova flavor-create --ephemeral $ironic_ephemeral_disk baremetal auto $ironic_node_ram $adjusted_disk $ironic_node_cpu nova flavor-key baremetal set "cpu_arch"="$ironic_node_arch" iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG baremetal instance_type "baremetal"

commit_message:
Add commands listed in DEVSTACK_GATE_ADD_TEMPEST_SUDO to tempest sudoers

This makes it possible to add sudo permission for commands listed
by DEVSTACK_GATE_ADD_TEMPEST_SUDO environment variables.
The command list should be specified by a comma separator.
For example it will be like the following:
  DEVSTACK_GATE_ADD_TEMPEST_SUDO="/usr/bin/ovs-vsctl,/usr/bin/docker"

Change-Id: I15eddbe468dd43f3b90d1474c4eb27f2ab9e98c3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/82/355682/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: local addcmd for addcmd in ${DEVSTACK_GATE_ADD_TEMPEST_SUDO//,/ }; do echo "tempest ALL=(root) NOPASSWD:$addcmd" >>$TEMPFILE done

subject: Improve error reporting for missing nested template
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-25 18:21:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/169614cdc51bf9bfa812ffd9e230bc7170f0addc', 'message': "Improve error reporting for missing nested template

When the template for a TemplateResource was missing from the files dict
and not otherwise available, we provided misleading feedback when
validating the parent template.

First, we log that we are fetching the template from a URL, even though we
would not actually attempt to do so if it is a file:/// URL. Move the log
to after the allowed scheme check, and log debug to indicate when we cannot
find a template file.

While an exception would be generated in
TemplateResource._generate_schema() at resource initialisation time, it is
suppressed and saved for later. An empty template is used to generate the
properties schema. The exception is re-raised when validate() is called,
but during a template validation we only call validate_template(), not
validate(), so the first error we run into will be a mismatch of property
names. (If no property values were passed in the parent template, we may
not even get an error even though we won't be able to create a stack from
the given data.) Also re-raise the stored exception at the beginning of
validate_template() so that users will see the true source of the error.

Change-Id: I1bc100684e1b84fc9ac54ef523d798b317e4dc51
Related-Bug: #1739447
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-01-27 02:40:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/11adcb022487c690308a72d1268c5a26633131f0', 'message': "Improve error reporting for missing nested template

commit_message:
Improve error reporting for missing nested template

When the template for a TemplateResource was missing from the files dict
and not otherwise available, we provided misleading feedback when
validating the parent template.

First, we log that we are fetching the template from a URL, even though we
would not actually attempt to do so if it is a file:/// URL. Move the log
to after the allowed scheme check, and log debug to indicate when we cannot
find a template file.

While an exception would be generated in
TemplateResource._generate_schema() at resource initialisation time, it is
suppressed and saved for later. An empty template is used to generate the
properties schema. The exception is re-raised when validate() is called,
but during a template validation we only call validate_template(), not
validate(), so the first error we run into will be a mismatch of property
names. (If no property values were passed in the parent template, we may
not even get an error even though we won't be able to create a stack from
the given data.) Also re-raise the stored exception at the beginning of
validate_template() so that users will see the true source of the error.

Change-Id: I1bc100684e1b84fc9ac54ef523d798b317e4dc51
Story: #1739447

commit_message:
test_mount_unmount cleanup

mock assert_has_calls is checking the entire integrity of the call
path, it's ok to just do that call path check once at the end. This
unrolls this test as an example for more clarity.

Change-Id: I89a25c23e7b9e20d711e8c7d56d54365f1bae388

commit_message:
WIP: demonstrate no use of external locking

This is a poisoned fixture that would trigger if we actually tried to
take an external lock, and the lack of failure means we don't go down
this path.

Change-Id: I7a0c724e6da3055d9e3465657c18416f1a177ca1

commit_message:
Remove REQUIRES_LOCKING as nothing needs process locking in the tests

It's unclear why any of our code currently believes it actually needs
process locking between tests, especially as annotating external
locking to be poisoned doesn't ever seem to touch that code. Remove
this confusion from our test suites.

Change-Id: Ic261518d1a8e11686c7026b4ea61e81af2c914cc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/28/507528/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: REQUIRES_LOCKING = False # NOTE(sdague): because of the way we were using the lock # wrapper we ended up with a lot of tests that started # relying on global external locking being set up for them. We # consider all of these to be *bugs*. Tests should not require # global external locking, or if they do, they should # explicitly set it up themselves. # # The following REQUIRES_LOCKING class parameter is provided # as a bridge to get us there. No new tests should be added # that require it, and existing classes and tests should be # fixed to not need it. if self.REQUIRES_LOCKING: lock_path = self.useFixture(fixtures.TempDir()).path self.fixture = self.useFixture( config_fixture.Config(lockutils.CONF)) self.fixture.config(lock_path=lock_path, group='oslo_concurrency')

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-08-04 17:17:09.000000000', 'files': ['openstackdocstheme/theme/openstackdocs/static/css/combined.css'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstackdocstheme/commit/dbe19d58a683fc9656668f778d2cec40844159e5', 'message': "Tweak css for sidebar

Change-Id: I0faf6bf19824a6be31c7eed08b23cc417932958a
"}]
commit_message:
Tweak css for sidebar

Because of the way ul elements stack up on each other, the indentation
for 2nd level topics in the TOC were really 40px in. This is a lot of
real estate to take up for this, especially with long titles.

To reset this back to 20, we also need to unwind some css hacking
going on in the local-table-of-contents, otherwise it completely
looses it's margin. The ul:first-of-type isn't really the right pseudo
class here, as that's not about nesting but about linear order. And
what we really need to do is get rid of the outer padding but leave it
for 2 level and down.

Change-Id: I0faf6bf19824a6be31c7eed08b23cc417932958a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstackdocstheme refs/changes/91/490991/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
remove old auth_host / auth_port

This really isn't going to work in future devstack iterations, so
remove it so that dependency on it doesn't sneak back into swift
functional tests.

Needs a swiftclient change before this can land to not break swift.

Change-Id: Ide58670b193f1df6f41836f908018c786fef1d7e
Depends-On: Ie427f3b0b9eb834ff940fa5d52444a5a6cdcab15

commit_message:
Allow swift functional tests to use keystone auth uri

Devstack is working through changes to drop the special ports on
things like keystone, as such everything is going to need to
understand and work with keystone auth_uri. This change allows the
swift functional tests to consume the auth_uri directly.

Change-Id: Ie427f3b0b9eb834ff940fa5d52444a5a6cdcab15

deleted_lines: auth_host = config.get('func_test', 'auth_host') auth_port = config.getint('func_test', 'auth_port') auth_ssl = config.getboolean('func_test', 'auth_ssl') self.auth_url = "" if auth_ssl: self.auth_url += "https://" else: self.auth_url += "http://" self.auth_url += "%s:%s%s" % (auth_host, auth_port, auth_prefix)

commit_message:
add regression test for bug #1538011

This builds a test using a real mysql db (with the mysql opportunistic
bits from oslo.db), then spawns the API layer on top of it.

It then replicates the aggregates fail scenario of setting metadata
abc=1 followed by ABC=2. On mysql this triggers a 500 error due to
text string matching in a case insensitive way.

Note: this currently fails, will need the fix at the same time to land
this patch.

Related-Bug: #1538011

Change-Id: Ic09327ff3485477b1b22d1f15e0c3dd962011361

You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import json from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_db.sqlalchemy import test_base as odbtest from nova.db import migration import nova.scheduler.utils import nova.servicegroup from nova import test from nova.tests import fixtures as nova_fixtures import nova.tests.unit.image.fake from nova.tests.unit import policy_fixture CONF = cfg.CONF class TestAggregateCase(odbtest.MySQLOpportunisticTestCase, test.NoDBTestCase): REQUIRES_LOCKING = True microversion = None def setUp(self): super(TestAggregateCase, self).setUp() # NOTE(sdague): because this has a mysql backend, we have to # manually setup the mysql db and configure it for all the # services. self.useFixture(nova_fixtures.ConfPatcher( group='database', connection=self.engine.url)) self.engine.connect() migration.db_sync(database='main') self.useFixture(policy_fixture.RealPolicyFixture()) api_fixture = self.useFixture(nova_fixtures.OSAPIFixture( api_version='v2.1')) # the image fake backend needed for image discovery nova.tests.unit.image.fake.stub_out_image_service(self) self.addCleanup(nova.tests.unit.image.fake.FakeImageService_reset) self.api = api_fixture.admin_api def test_aggregate_case_sensitivity(self): """Regression test for bug #1538011. Aggregate metadata is case sensitive in the API, however the SQL used to look it up for modification uses string matching at the DB layer. Mysql is case insensitive for these searches, so without additional work this will explode when writing metadata with both upper and lower case. """ aggregate = dict(name="agg1") r = self.api.api_post('os-aggregates', {'aggregate': aggregate}) agg_id = json.loads(r.content)['aggregate']['id'] def set_metadata(**kwargs): return { "set_metadata": { "metadata": kwargs } } self.api.api_post('os-aggregates/%s/action' % agg_id, set_metadata(abc="1")) # this triggers the fail self.api.api_post( 'os-aggregates/%s/action' % agg_id, set_metadata(ABC="2"))

commit_message:
Configure [neutron] in nova_cell*.conf

The nova-conductor service running in the cell
needs to be configured to talk to neutron for
things like deallocating networks during server
build failure. This changes the configure_neutron_nova
flows such that the top-level nova.conf is configured
as before, but we also configure each nova_cell*.conf
cell conductor config files to also be able to talk
to neutron.

Change-Id: Ic5e17298996b5fb085272425bb3b68583247aa34
Closes-Bug: #1777505

commit_message:
ha-guide: fix incorrect statement about innodb_flush_log_at_trx_commit

It looks like there was a typo for the values of innodb_flush_log_at_trx_commit

Per http://galeracluster.com/documentation-webpages/configuration.html

Note Warning: While setting innodb_flush_log_at_trx_commit to a value of
0 or 2 improves performance, it also introduces certain dangers.
Operating system crashes or power outages can erase the last second of
transaction. Although normally you can recover this data from another
node, it can still be lost entirely in the event that the cluster goes
down at the same time, (for instance, in the event of a data center
power outage).

Change-Id: I09d0e0be4c85e6bd5469a35482a6392491168298

commit_message:
Add configurable option for Ironic master tftp images path

By design, Ironic will be making hardlinks from /var/lib/ironic/master_images
into /httpboot. On a machine where /var is on a separate partition, deployment
will succeed but operation will fail with some errors like:

OSError: [Errno 18] Invalid cross-device link

in ironic conductor logs. This patch adds an extra configuration
variable which allows the user to configure the path location
properly and to overcome this issue.

Change-Id: If90b49c75ff1a224d8d539036b89c1c7ee030bd0

commit_message:
Replace port 35357 with 5000

Now that the v2.0 API has been removed, we don't have a reason to
include deployment instructions for two separate applications on
different ports.

Change-Id: I6267a1b6189601e117d28be342864688d3522aa6

commit_message:
libvirt: Log breadcrumb for known encryption bug

The initial implementation of native LUKS support within Libvirt
introduced a small issue when using a passphrase that is a multiple of
16 bytes in size. This is documented in the following bug and associated
patch posted to the Libvirt development list:

Unable to use LUKS passphrase that is exactly 16 bytes long
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1447297

[libvirt] [PATCH] Fix padding of encrypted data
https://www.redhat.com/archives/libvir-list/2017-May/msg00030.html

This change introduces a known issue release note and logs an additional
breadcrumb when we appear to hit this with pointers to the above.

Closes-Bug: #1778044
Change-Id: Id346bce6e47431988cce7001abcf29a9faf2936a

commit_message:
Add proposal "Vitage high availability - fast failover"

Change-Id: I23bd339c44dd16fed364c5669eb243885752a23f
implements: blueprint vitrage-fast-failover
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/vitrage-specs refs/changes/79/575379/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================ Vitrage-graph init from database ================================ https://blueprints.launchpad.net/vitrage/+spec/vitrage-fast-failover vitrage-graph high availability should meet these requirements: - Single active instance of vitrage-graph (managed by pacemaker). - Initialize quickly upon failover without requesting updates. - In case of downtime, Vitrage-graph startup will requests collector updates Problem description =================== Vitrage-graph is active standby, currently on a failover vitrage-graph needs to pull all the data again from the collector data-sources. This takes a considerable amount of time, in which data is inconsistent. As we wish to continue working with an in-memory graph (due to performance) we are forced to to be active-standby. So in the event of a failover we must minimize the downtime. Proposed change =============== - Vitrage-graph stores a full entity graph snapshot in the db, after every get_all so the majority of events do not need to be replayed - Vitrage-graph sends each processed event to vitrage-persistor so these are stored in the order of handling. - Upon init vitrage-graph queries the db table graph_snapshots, fetching the latest entry, it will be used once not older than snapshot_interval. Init with a snapshot - on failover - Unpickle stored snapshot to get the graph. - Replay all the events in the events table (that occurred after snapshot). - Enable the evaluators. - Process all the events that are waiting in the message bus. Init without a snapshot - a fresh start (This is the current behaviour). - Start with a new empty graph. - RPC to Collector to run get_all for all drivers, then process the events. - Process all the events that are waiting in the message bus. - Enable evaluator and iterate all graph. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Versioning impact ----------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Deployer impact --------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Horizon impact -------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: idan-hefetz Other contributors: None Work Items ---------- None Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= New behaviour is already covered by existing tempest. Some additinal tempest will be added testing for failover Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== None

commit_message:
Raise TemporaryFailure if no conductors are online

Return 503 Service Unavailable error in case no conductors
are online. This indicate to the caller that it can retry
the operation. (Previously a 400 error was returned,
which is confusing because it is not a user error.)

Story: 2002600
Task:  22214
Change-Id: I2c21baaec2e35c0a63f3f4a95990b12c6a836065

added_lines: | 1.45 - Return Temporary error in case no conductors are online. RPC_API_VERSION = '1.45' # There are no conductors, temporary failure - 503 Service Unavailable if not self.ring_manager.ring: raise exception.TemporaryFailure()
deleted_lines: RPC_API_VERSION = '1.44'
